derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French bastir 'sew lightly', ultimately of Germanic origin and related to bast
mid 16th cent.: perhaps a figurative use of baste

entry.tran: 往（肉类食品）上浇热油及肉汁
entry.def: If you baste meat, you pour hot fat and the juices from the meat itself over it while it is cooking.

example.ex: Pam was in the middle of basting the turkey...
example.tran: 帕姆正在往烤鸡上淋油。

sentences.en: The turkey is basted to keep it from drying out.

sentences.en: Meat is basted to keep it from drying out and to improve its flavour.
